adrFormatAddress: 286 1st Ave., New York, NY 10009, USA

editorialSummary.text: Fast-food chain offering Mexican fare, including design-your-own burritos, tacos & bowls.

originalText.text: Honestly this location used to be my favorite to go to but I’m guessing this location must be where they train new people. The workers change so frequently and the service honestly has just gotten bad. The attitude of the people that work at this location is horrible. I always order guacamole and chips and it’s always salty. I stopped coming to this location on a whole but I visited today because someone else was buying me food and I ordered the guacamole and of course it’s EXTREMELY SALTY and I don’t want to go back because it’s cold. I just give up on this location. Will always love and eat chipotle but this location is not it. My favorite person that used to work at this location has moved to the 14 street union square location and I actually go there often and have no complaints about that location or the workers or the food. The guacamole at union square is always yummy.

originalText.text: Moved to the neighborhood recently and this is not my favorite location. Unfortunately, there's not a fast casual place close by so there is not a lot of competition for a quick, relatively healthy meal. They always run out of items and they try to skimp people on food portions for some reason. The water button was also broken for a while at least as of December and ive seen multiple people encounter this. On a positive note, its not too busy during lunch time in the store, so I end up coming when I'm really lazy.

originalText.text:
This was the absolute WORST food I have ever had. I got the keithadilla, seeing it all over the internet it looked amazing. Opened my box, first thing I noticed is the fajitas that are supposed to be inside are outside. Okay fine, I can stuff it myself. Took a bite into the quesadilla (that was hard and looked mediocre but wanted to try it) and the taste of salt was overwhelming. My steak was so dry, salty, and tasted like fish. Threw the whole
Thing away. I’m never coming here again.

originalText.text: Every single time I order from this location there is an issue. Horrible management and consistent mistakes with my very simple order. Their soda machine will be broken for six months on end and then when you get to the restaurant they tell you they can’t refund you. You’ll mobile order and show up at the specified time and have to wait 20 minutes extra because they don’t have a worker staffed on the to-go station. You’ll get home with your order and it’ll be half wrong and missing. I don’t think there is a worse Chipotle location in all of Manhattan.

originalText.text: At the time of this visit I asked the cashier if I could have vinaigrette with my order, without looking, he immediately says “we don’t have any vinaigrette.” I said to him “I saw it, I just forgot to ask for it before.” He turns to his coworker and asked her if there was any vinaigrette, she looks over at the vinaigrette and looks back at him and says “no.” I pay for my food and I walk over to the employee nearest to the vinaigrette and I ask him to give me one and he does. The service at this location is ALWAYS POOR. I expect a rude employee, I expect an attitude every single time I enter this location. I try to give them grace because I have worked in the service industry, but I can no longer support this location. There has to be a reason the employees are so unhappy. Is this location severely understaffed or do they just not want to work? I think the quality of chipotle has gone down a lot since inception and it is so sad. It used to be a great place to get quality fast food. Now I just get berated with a side of cold food. DO BETTER.
